title: Strategies for Enhancing Participation of Multicultural and Low-Income Students in Gifted Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Core Gifted Education Concepts and Basic Understanding of Educational Program Management
context.additional_context: A social sector training program for working professionals conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment. Learning outcomes are measured via project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Design giftedness assessment methods for multicultural and low-income students using revised identification procedures.
Propose strategies to improve learning engagement by 30% or more for CLED (Cultural, Linguistic, and Ethnic Diversity) students through personalized educational design.

Learners can design an operational manual for a corporate employee child education program (2–4 week course) using three communication channels (email, mobile app, monthly face-to-face meetings) to establish collaboration systems with parents/families, develop a checklist for evaluating program sustainability (participation rate ≥80%, feedback ≥2 times/month, satisfaction ≥4/5), and submit it to program managers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
